meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or avoids work.
meanings.sent1: My brother is a bummer; he never helps with chores.
meanings.sent2: The new employee turned out to be a real bummer, always slacking off.
meanings.sent3: The bummer at the office always finds a way to skip tasks.
meanings.sent4: Being a bummer is like carrying a heavy weight of laziness.
meanings.sent5: The image of a bummer lounging on the couch is hard to forget.

meanings.definition: Something that is disappointing or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: Rain on the picnic was a real bummer for everyone.
meanings.sent2: Missing the bus was such a bummer on a busy morning.
meanings.sent3: The melted ice cream was a bummer on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The broken toy was a bummer, ruining the playtime.
meanings.sent5: The canceled concert was a huge bummer for the fans.

meanings.sent1: She bummers when her favorite show ends.
meanings.sent2: I bummers every time I lose a game.
meanings.sent3: He bummers when his ice cream falls on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Bummers like a dark cloud over a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The child bummers after dropping his ice cream cone.
